stage1_death.name: Al-Mawt (The Moment of Death)
stage1_death.process_righteous: Angels of mercy with faces like the sun bring shrouds from Paradise. Soul drawn out gently 'like water from a waterskin.' Angels greet: 'O good soul, come out to forgiveness and pleasure from Allah.'
stage1_death.process_wicked: Angels of punishment with dark faces bring coarse shrouds from Hell. Soul torn out painfully 'like thorns being dragged through wool.' Angels say: 'O evil soul, come out to the wrath of Allah.'

stage2_ascension.name: Journey to the Heavens
stage2_ascension.description: Righteous soul taken upward through the heavens. At each gate, angels ask who this is. Upon identification as righteous, gates open with welcome. Wicked soul attempts to ascend but is rejected and cast back down.

stage3_grave.name: Al-Qabr (The Grave)
stage3_grave.description: First resting place - either 'a garden from the gardens of Paradise' or 'a pit from the pits of Hell'
questions: What do you say about this man [Muhammad]? (Ma taqulu fi hadha ar-rajul?)
stage3_grave.result_righteous: Grave expands, window to Paradise opens, soul rests in peace
stage3_grave.result_wicked: Grave constricts until ribs interlock, window to Hell opens

stage4_barzakh.name: Barzakh (The Intermediate Realm)
stage4_barzakh.description: Dimension between earthly life and resurrection. Time varies but feels different than earthly time.
characteristics: Can hear living visitors but cannot respond
Martyrs given special status - dwelling in crops of green birds in Paradise
stage4_barzakh.quranic_reference: Quran 23:100 - 'And behind them is Barzakh until the Day they are resurrected.'

stage5_resurrection.name: Yawm al-Qiyamah (Day of Resurrection)
stage5_resurrection.description: The End of Time and Recreation of Bodies

trumpet.first_blast: All living beings die; creation ceases; the universe collapses
trumpet.second_blast: All souls resurrected from the coccyx bone (which never decays)

stage5_resurrection.gathering: All humanity from Adam to the last person stands on a vast plain. The sun draws near, causing distress proportional to sins.
stage5_resurrection.duration: A day the extent of which is fifty thousand years (Quran 70:4) - though believers experience it as a few hours

stage6_judgment.name: Yawm ad-Din (Day of Judgment)

book_of_deeds.right_hand: Righteous receive their book in right hand, face glowing with joy
book_of_deeds.left_hand: Wicked receive from left hand or behind, face darkened with despair

scale.name: Al-Mizan
scale.description: Deeds weighed on massive scale. If good outweighs bad = Paradise. If bad outweighs good = Hell.

Your lifeâ€”how did you use it?
Your wealthâ€”how did you earn and spend it?
Your knowledgeâ€”did you act upon it?
Your bodyâ€”how did you use it?

stage6_judgment.intercession: Prophet Muhammad will intercede for his ummah. Other prophets, angels, and martyrs may also intercede with Allah's permission.

stage7_bridge.name: As-Sirat (The Bridge)
stage7_bridge.description: Bridge stretched over Jahannam, thinner than a hair and sharper than a sword
stage7_bridge.righteous_crossing: Cross with speed proportional to faith and deeds - some like lightning, some like wind, some walking carefully but safely
stage7_bridge.hypocrites: Light extinguishes midway; they fall into Hell
stage7_bridge.wicked: Fall immediately into the flames below
stage7_bridge.final_stop: Al-Qantarah - between Hell and Paradise where believers settle accounts with each other

death.questioning: Munkar and Nakir question in grave
death.barzakh: Intermediate realm until Day of Judgment

levels.name: Jahannam
levels.description: Uppermost level for Muslim sinners who will eventually be released

levels.name: Laza
levels.description: A blazing fire that snatches away the scalp (Quran 70:16)

levels.name: Sa'ir
levels.description: A blazing flame that roasts the body

levels.name: Al-Jahim (The Fierce Flame)
levels.description: Extreme heat and fierce flames for idolaters

levels.name: Al-Hawiyah (The Abyss)
levels.description: Deepest pit for hypocrites - the worst of the worst

jahannam.duration: Eternal for unbelievers, temporary for sinful Muslims
punishments: Fire 70 times hotter than earthly fire
Skin constantly regenerates to feel pain
Zaqqum tree with fruit like devils' heads
Boiling water, pus, and scalding drinks
Clothes of fire, tar, and pitch

levels.name: Jannatul Firdaus
levels.description: The Highest Paradise - directly under the Throne of Allah. Home of prophets, martyrs, and the most righteous.

levels.name: Jannat-ul-Adn (Garden of Eden)
levels.description: Permanent dwelling, eternal home promised to believers

levels.name: Jannat-un-Naim (Garden of Delight)
levels.description: Place of supreme comfort and pleasure

levels.name: Jannat-ul-Mawa (Garden of Refuge)
levels.description: Safe haven, place of shelter and peace

levels.name: Jannat-ul-Khuld (Garden of Immortality)
levels.description: Eternal existence without death, aging, or change

pleasures: Rivers of water, milk, wine (without intoxication), and honey
Silk and brocade garments with gold bracelets
Any food or drink the soul desires
Reunion with righteous family and friends
Everyone in form of Adam - 33 years old, perfect beauty
jannah.greatest_reward: The Beatific Vision - seeing Allah Himself on Fridays. This surpasses all other pleasures of Paradise.
jannah.description: Paradise gardens - 'No eye has seen, no ear has heard, and no human mind has conceived what Allah has prepared for those who love Him.'

judgment.book: Book of deeds given (right hand = saved, left = damned)
judgment.bridge: Sirat bridge over hell - sharp as sword

description: Islamic eschatology presents a comprehensive journey of the soul through seven stages: from the moment of death (Al-Mawt), through the heavenly ascension, the grave questioning (Al-Qabr), Barzakh (the intermediate realm), resurrection on the Day of Judgment (Yawm al-Qiyamah), the crossing of the Sirat bridge, and finally eternal dwelling in Jannah (Paradise) or Jahannam (Hell) based on faith and deeds.
name: Islamic Afterlife

azrael.name: Azrael (Izrail)
azrael.description: Extracts souls at the appointed time. The experience differs for righteous and wicked souls.

israfil.name: Israfil
israfil.description: Will blow the trumpet (Sur) to signal the end of time and resurrection.

munkar_nakir.description: Question every deceased person about their Lord, religion, and the Prophet.

malik.name: Malik
malik.description: Stern angel who leads the Zabaniya (19 gatekeepers of Hell), showing no mercy in executing divine justice.

quran: Quran 29:57 - Every soul will taste death
Quran 4:78 - Death will overtake you wherever you are
Quran 70:4 - Day of fifty thousand years
Quran 69:19-25 - Book of deeds in right or left hand
Quran 10:26 - The greatest reward (vision of Allah)
Quran 4:48 - Allah does not forgive shirk
Quran 50:30 - Hell asks 'Are there any more?'
hadith: Sahih Bukhari - Book of Funerals, Book of Riqaq
Sahih Muslim - Book of Paradise and Hell, Book of Faith
scholarly: Al-Ghazali - 'The Remembrance of Death and the Afterlife' (Ihya Ulum al-Din, Book 40)
Ibn Qayyim al-Jawziyya - 'The Soul's Journey After Death' (Kitab ar-Ruh)
Tafsir Ibn Kathir - Commentary on eschatological verses
Imam Suyuti - 'The Hereafter: Heaven and Hell'

theological_points.divine_justice_and_mercy: Islamic eschatology balances perfect justice with overwhelming mercy. No one is wronged. 'Whoever brings a good deed will have ten times the like thereof, but whoever brings an evil deed will not be recompensed except the like thereof' (Quran 6:160).
purpose_of_belief: Moral accountability - actions have eternal consequences
Ultimate justice - wrongs in this life addressed in the next
Divine wisdom - life's trials are temporary; ultimate fairness guaranteed
Motivation - hope in Paradise encourages righteousness; fear of Hell deters evil
Perspective - this life is brief preparation; the afterlife is eternal reality

cross_tradition_parallels.jewish: Sheol/Gehinnom as place of punishment, Gan Eden as paradise, resurrection belief
cross_tradition_parallels.christian: Heaven/Hell, resurrection, final judgment, bridge imagery
cross_tradition_parallels.egyptian: Heart weighing (scale of deeds), journey through dangerous realms, judgment by deity
cross_tradition_parallels.zoroastrian: Chinvat Bridge parallel to Sirat bridge
